snippet: The new research on western Canada’s glaciers had implications for predicting glacier loss around the world caused by climate change.
abstract: Report published in journal Nature Geoscience uses new interdisciplinary method to predict that Western Canadian glaciers will shrink to less than 10 percent of their 2005 size by 2100; glacier loss could have significant effects on water availability and quality.
lead_paragraph: The new research on western Canada’s glaciers had implications for predicting glacier loss around the world caused by climate change.

headline.main: Study Forecasts 70% Loss of West Canada’s Glaciers
headline.print_headline: Study Forecasts 70% Loss of West Canada’s Glaciers
